ReportSection.title: AGE-WELL Platform Project Scorecard (2019-2020)
ReportSection.ReportItem:
Please complete the project scorecard provided. You should specifically respond to the reviewer feedback from the Core Research Program (CRP) Request for Proposals. You should identify areas of strength and weakness of the project and team and identify concrete goals, activities and deliverables (e.g. a plan, report/paper, market analysis, environmental scan) for the year in order to strengthen your project as they pertain to NCE Program Criteria. Please keep in mind that the feedback provided to you is based on a review of your proposal for the CRP- Catalyst program and not a Pilot Project.

AGE-WELL Platform Projects address issues of network-wide importance and provide tangible added-value to the Network in alignment with its mission. In 2018, AGE-WELL’s Board of Directors identified the development and management of data platforms as an area of strategic importance and future investment. Considerations to be addressed within a new cluster of data platform projects may include: secure storage of and shared access to big data sets; federation of diverse databases, including data from sources outside the Network; data portals to facilitate access to federated data; and analytic tools such as data mining and visualization. Other considerations are expected to emerge over time.

As previously communicated, the expectations of the seed funding phase include activities related to:

  • Building partnerships and team capacity;
  • Developing knowledge mobilization and commercialization plans;
  • Developing relationships with the stakeholders;
  • Developing relationships and collaborations with the other projects within the Challenge Areas and across the Network; and
  • Recruitment of the full research team to hit the ground running in April 2020.

Through these activities, projects should be positioned not only to maximize the likelihood of producing specific outputs, but also to contribute to the development of AGE-WELL Challenge Areas.

You should also outline:

  • Any activities or steps you will take during the seed funding phase to ensure that your Platform Project is ready to start in April 2020.
  • Any supports or resources that you feel your project would benefit from. AGE-WELL’s Network Management Office is keen to work with all the Platform Projects which have access to numerous supports and resources across the Network that may be useful to projects.
  • How the project will work with the Core Research Program projects and connect with the Challenge Areas.

The project scorecard will be submitted to AGE-WELL by August 9, 2019. It will be used by the Network Management Office to match projects with mentors and to create individual project support and resource packages (e.g. links to specific partners, cross-cutting activities, people, etc.).

In January 2020, projects will return to the scorecard and reflect on their work during the seed funding phase. The updated scorecard and a two-page progress report will be submitted for evaluation.

NCE Program Criteria

Scientific Excellence
The AGE-WELL Core Research Program (CRP) must be driven to address Canadian needs and problems and to demonstrate world-class scientific achievements. AGE-WELL is also committed to a transdisciplinary approach.

Networking and Partnerships
The project must demonstrate that it has brought together the key individuals and organizations needed to generate and implement multifaceted solutions to the complex challenges it is designed to address. It must be built on relationships with partners and the receptor community that will accelerate the activities, outcomes and impact of the project.

Knowledge and Technology Exchange and Exploitation – Knowledge Mobilization & Commercialization
NCE Networks are expected to generate social and economic benefits by ensuring the rapid flow of knowledge, ideas and innovations from researchers to Canadian receptors. Projects are expected to demonstrate that the appropriate activities will be undertaken and the appropriate resources allocated to maximize those benefits through effective stakeholder engagement and communication.

Training of HQP
Training is expected to add value to the formal training initiatives already available through the academic community and should aim at helping HQP find employment in the Canadian economy, particularly in sectors related to technology and aging. HQP should be directly involved in the range of activities in a multi-disciplinary team research project and should work closely with industry and community partners and be involved in collaborating within the AGE-WELL research network and partner universities.

Project and Management and Team
Projects need to have effective management and team-working processes in place and to demonstrate that the team possesses the necessary expertise and capacity to successfully complete their project
